alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 11:23AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1122 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles west of Intersection Krome And U.S. 27 to near The Redland to 7 miles southeast of Royal Palm Ranger. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, funnel clouds, and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Miami Beach, Homestead, Coral Gables, Key Biscayne, South Miami, Surfside, Homestead General Airport, Miami Gardens, Turkey Point, Virginia Key, Hallandale, Homestead Miami Speedway, Black Point, The Redland and Kendall. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
